questions.question: If you heat ice, it ___.
questions.explanation: This is Zero Conditional: If + present simple, present simple.

questions.question: If I see her, I ___ her the news.
questions.explanation: This is First Conditional: If + present simple, will + base verb.

questions.question: If I were you, I ___ a jacket.
questions.explanation: Second Conditional: If + past simple, would + base verb.

questions.question: If they had studied more, they ___ the test.
questions.explanation: Third Conditional: If + past perfect, would have + past participle.

questions.question: If you mix red and blue, you ___ purple.
I would have called you if I ___ your number.
questions.explanation: Third Conditional: the condition uses past perfect.

questions.question: If he ___ harder, he would be better at English.
If we ___ earlier, we wouldn’t have missed the train.
questions.explanation: Third Conditional for a past regret.

questions.question: If she ___ the bus, she’ll be late.
What would you do if you ___ a million dollars?
If I hadn’t eaten so much, I ___ sick.
questions.explanation: Third Conditional: result in the past.

questions.question: If she ___ more time, she could finish the book.
If I ___ you, I wouldn’t do that.
questions.explanation: 'If I were you' is a common Second Conditional phrase.

questions.question: If he hadn’t lost his keys, he ___ home by now.
questions.explanation: Mixed Conditional: past condition + present result.

questions.question: If I ___ earlier, I wouldn’t be so tired now.
questions.explanation: Mixed Conditional: Third (past) condition + present result.
